metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6831 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: The "process-execute" and "process-spawn" procedures did not free memory correctly when the execve() call failed, resulting in a memory leak. This could be abused by an attacker to cause resource exhaustion or a denial of service. This affects all releases of CHICKEN up to and including 4.11 (it will be fixed in 4.12 and 5.0, which are not yet released).

notes.Note: ratliff> Fixed in same upstream patch as CVE-2016-6830

criterions.comment: chicken package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.12.0-0.1').
